name: Regis

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I haven't seen you before - what brings you to the Great Khans?

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: Name's Regis - I'm Papa Khan's advisor and right-hand man. I'm also the chief enforcer of the tribe's laws - so watch your behavior.

topics.topic_text: RegisCaesar
topics.response_text: I heard you try to convince Papa Khan not to join with Caesar's Legion. I'd like to talk to you about that for a moment.

topics.topic_text: What's your opinion of the NCR?
topics.response_text: That's a complicated question. They've done horrible things to our people to be sure, and I've gladly killed many of their soldiers in battle.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Papa Khan.
topics.response_text: Papa is one of the best leaders the Khans have ever had. He's kept us together through all of our hardships, ever since we left California.

topics.topic_text: So if you were in charge of the tribe, you'd fight with the NCR against Caesar if asked?
topics.response_text: I suppose if asked, I would. But that's a moot point, because Papa's in charge now, and he's not going anywhere.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: Name's Regis. I'm Papa's second-in-command. You might say I... share your concern about Caesar.

topics.topic_text: What is it you had in mind?
topics.response_text: You want to convince Papa not to ally with Caesar, right? Trust me, you'll get nowhere just talking to him about it.

topics.topic_text: Why should I listen to you?
topics.response_text: Because Papa listens to me. And because I actually know how to get things done around here.

topics.topic_text: So what do I do?
topics.response_text: Papa can be a stubborn man, but he's not a tyrant. He listens to his tribe, and to four voices in particular: me, Jack and Diane, and Melissa.

topics.topic_text: Aren't you convinced already, if we're having this conversation?
topics.response_text: I have my doubts about Caesar, yes, but I won't publicly go against Papa Khan based on nothing more than doubts.

topics.topic_text: What would convince Jack and Diane to support me?
topics.response_text: You'd have to talk to them - but those two have been thick as thieves since they were kids. Convince one and the other will come around.

topics.topic_text: What about Melissa?
topics.response_text: Ah, Melissa. She's a bit of a dreamer. Last time she was in camp, Karl filled her head with stories of serving the Legion as a{SPECK-you-lay-tor-ay}speculatore.

topics.topic_text: What did you mean about Papa's hatred poisoning his mind?
topics.response_text: Nothing, forget about it. I shouldn't be talking about this with an outsider.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll see what I can do to convince everyone.
topics.response_text: Good. Oh, one more thing: Caesar's representative, Karl, has become fast friends with Papa. Karl's the one who has him so fixated on this alliance.

topics.topic_text: I don't think I actually want to do that.
topics.response_text: I see. Then the Great Khans will fight for the Legion should Caesar give the call. If you change your mind, let me know.

topics.topic_text: I'll think about it, but I have other questions for now.
topics.response_text: All right, what is it you wanted?

topics.topic_text: How would I do that?
topics.response_text: Karl talks prettily about the honor and nobility of the Great Khans, but I suspect his actual opinion is less flattering.

topics.topic_text: I'll keep that in mind.
topics.response_text: I would too, if I were you.

topics.topic_text: I'm not afraid of Karl, and I don't feel like wasting my time on him.
topics.response_text: If you say so.

topics.topic_text: Nothing, never mind.
topics.response_text: Suit yourself.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Bitter Springs.
topics.response_text: I really don't like to talk about it. Let's just say it was a tragedy and the NCR is to blame, and we'll leave it at that.

topics.topic_text: Never mind, I have other questions.
topics.response_text: Sure, go ahead.

topics.topic_text: What kind of doubts?
topics.response_text: I just don't trust the words of Caesar's ambassador that much. He's promising a lot, and I don't see the advantage for him. It makes me suspicious.

topics.topic_text: We fight for Caesar.
topics.response_text: As you wish. When Caesar goes to war, we go with him.

topics.topic_text: We fight for the NCR.
topics.response_text: As you wish. When the Republic goes to war, we go with it.

topics.topic_text: I'm giving leadership to you. I want you to take the tribe north, and find yourselves a new life.
topics.response_text: {Surprised, didn't expect this}I... very well. If that's what you want, that's what we'll do.

topics.topic_text: We fight for ourselves. Bring our warriors to the battle and kill everyone.
topics.response_text: {Uncertain, thinks this is probably a suicide attack}As you wish, chieftain.

description:
Regis is a 38 year-old Caucasian Male.

Regis is a formidable figure and Papa Khan's most trusted advisor, serving as his right-hand man in the Great Khan settlement of Red Rock Canyon. With the highest Strength stat among all the Great Khans, he is the only named member to exclusively wield melee weapons in combat. As chief law enforcer, Regis maintains order in the Khan community and is known to warn outsiders to 'watch their step.' He stands out as the only one of Papa Khan's advisors who openly expresses suspicion toward Karl and Caesar's Legion.

Regis's Personality: Regis is a serious, intimidating, yet respected leader who commands authority through both his presence and actions. He is fiercely loyal to the Great Khans and Papa Khan, exhibiting a no-nonsense attitude toward maintaining order and protecting his people. Despite his intimidating demeanor, he possesses a certain 'cool' factor that earns him respect even from those who fear him.

Regis's Backstory: Regis rose through the ranks of the Great Khans through displays of exceptional combat prowess, particularly with melee weapons. His loyalty and effectiveness earned him Papa Khan's trust, eventually elevating him to the position of chief advisor and law enforcer. Having witnessed or experienced the brutality of Caesar's Legion firsthand, he maintains a deep-seated suspicion of outsiders and particularly distrusts Karl's influence over Papa Khan. His physical strength and combat skills make him an imposing figure both in the Khan longhouse and on the battlefield.
